medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute epigastric abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports that her pain began yesterday afternoon as sharp, epigastric pain without radiation, with continuous episodes of nausea and vomiting (non-bloody, non-bilious) lasting for 2 days. The vomiting provided slight relief of her abdominal pain. She experienced chills, but no fevers or sweats. No diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Nephrolithiasis, history of Clostridium difficile colitis, depression, hyperlipidemia, allergic rhinitis, status post tubal ligation.
medical_history.family_history: Coronary artery disease status post coronary artery bypass grafting in both parents.
